story:
Short Summary

"In 2009, nearly 15,000 American women and men ended up in an emergency room after being unwillingly, but intentionally, drugged by someone else." -Alan Mozes, HealthDay

My name is Nicholas Stahl, and I am the inventor of Safe Nite Stirrers. I am currently a freshman engineering student at Stevens Institute of Technology in Hoboken, studying Chemical Engineering. I realized that in today's day and age, it is become less and less safe to go out without having to worry about being at risk.

As the inventor of Safe Nite, I am dedicated to make going out to a club or a bar a safer experience. Every year, thousands of Americans, both men and women, are unwillingly, but intentionally drugged every year. Our mission is to reduce this number, and to make going out an overall safer experience. 

The Safe Nite stirrer looks like a regular stirrer, but in reality uses nanotechnology to test if there is a presence of drugs in your beverage, such as "roofies." I plan on selling Safe Nite stirrers in bulk to bars, night clubs, and other establishments that are prone to this problem. By distributing the product right to the establishments, I will be able to directly get the product to the people who need it the most. 

The groundbreaking nanotechnology that Safe Nite Stirrers use is able to change the color of the stirrer when drugs are tested in a beverage. Other products on the market include business cards and napkins that test for drugs in a beverage, but I felt that by putting the technology right in a stirrer that looks standard to the human eye, you will be more incognito when testing for drugs. 

Safe Nite looks like a normal stirrer at first glance...

But upon closer examination, you will see if uses nanotechnology to test when your beverage has been drugged!


As the inventor of Safe Nite Stirrers, I am looking for investors to fund my campaign. If enough money is raised to successfully fund my project, I am looking for $10,000 to make working prototypes of Safe Nite Stirrers.These would then be distributed  to potential bars and/or clubs that would use them. Once they are distributed and the product is being used, I will ask for feedback from the venues that decide to use them. Based on their feedback, I will make modifications to the project where they are necessary.  

We ask that you do not donate anonymously, because we love to know who our donors are and would love to be able to thank them for believing in our project!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to fund this project for whatever reason, that's okay! Here's how you can promote a safer night out: please share this web page with your friends and family. This is a product that everyone deserves to know about.

story:
Modern smartphones are very powerful - now we have a full-functional computer in the pocket. It is exciting! But one thing we are not happy about - texting on a smartphone. So we started the OCTODON project to bring advanced texting and coding capabilities to our smartphones.


We believe that it should not be necessary to have a desk with keyboard on top for a comfort typing. We believe that for cool mobile devices there should be a cool mobile keyboard. A really ergonomic device, not a micro-clone of an ancient typewriter.

We've built several iterations of prototypes, conducted First-time users tests and optimization - everything to make really ergonomic and fast device. We reached on our prototype fantastic 400 CPM speed!

We change the game - with the OCTODON you feel comfort and confidence of typing on your mobile devices!

Now you can have an ultimate tool for texting & coding in your pocket!
 


Meet OCTODON MOD for LENOVO MOTO Z!

We are happy to announce that Octodon is partnering with Lenovo to develop a Moto Z module which will power up your Moto Z with super-typing capabilities!

HI-TECH

OCTODON is a pocket-sized transformable mobile gadget. Being unfolded it features a comfortable grip while typing and editing texts on your smartphone. Now your keyboard is in your hands. Octodon involves all your fingers into the typing process, that's why Octodon is the fastest typing device among handheld mobile physical keyboards. Typing speed we achieved on the prototype is 400 CPM.

HOW IT WORKS

OCTODON keyboard is a backtyping device, 8 input elements are located on its back side.
Each of 8 back-side elements can be easily directionally pressed in one of four directions (up/down/left/right). So every letter of the alphabet is typed with the single slight movement of one of the fingers. Screen hints located similar to backside elements locations let user know which finger to move in which direction to type required letter.

Thumb’s elements are located on the front side and responsible for space, backspace, common punctuation marks and switching between input modes.

 
 

EASY TO LEARN

Very intuitive "matte glass" style interface helps you to start typing right out of the box. Octodon gives you distinct tactile feedback, and the perfect feeling of the keys. It is easy to learn and master.

 Just by solving your everyday tasks, by writing notes, code or emails you will quickly increase your speed. Touch-typing comes to you naturally – you do not need to memorize the layout… it just comes by itself soon. Just use Octodon and your mechanical memory will do the rest.

 

HIGHLY ADJUSTABLE

We all have unique hands of different size. But with our patented magnetic joysticks you can reposition OCTODON input elements individually, up to your hands - for the best fit. Either you have big or small fingers - it's good for both. OCTODON is the only keyboard that perfectly fits YOUR hand. Simply adjust the keyboard up to you.



You can set up your own configuration of input elements, assigning your custom commands and macros on them. You can even place additional joysticks to get even more input options.


WHAT PEOPLE ARE SAYING ABOUT OCTODON?

We've already presented OCTODON keyboard at many events all over the world. You could see it at CES'15, at MIT, at Pirate Summit in Germany, at Building Global Innovators events in Portugal, at Skolkovo Startup Village in Russia or elsewhere... Many people had a chance to try OCTODON for some time. We recorded some of their reviews to share with you.
 

OCTODON TEAM

Our strong devoted team is capable to solve all the challenges.
We've already done a huge stuff: designed the device, conducted tests, optimized the ergonomics and evaluated the learning curve.

We are positive and fond of active sports and we can't wait to produce our first OCTODONs for you and for ourselves, as we truly believe that we are building great product!

HISTORY

To achieve the best mobile typing experience we get trough numerous iterations - from proving the concept to making the device compact and adjustable.

story:
Our second campaign is now live!

 

Same budget, more features. Check it out: Odoo Product Configurator Modules

 

What is the Product Configurator?

  • A series of Odoo modules that offers users the freedom and flexibility over customizable products:
    • Product Configurator
    • Website Product Configurator
    • Product Configurator API (Work in Progress)
    • More planned...
  • For more details please visit our website

Is it for you?

  • Businesses and users
    • Having flexible product customization in a powerful tool such as Odoo will allow you to integrate your customers orders directly in your manufacturing / supply proccess.
    • All the time spent to process orders, insert them in the backend, educate clients on what is possible and not, manual error-prone human checks of builds will all be done automatically and safely by the client in an instant.
    • Ever experienced issues with separate eShop platforms and other backend softwares trying to act as a single system? With Odoo's rich backend modules, eCommerce platform and the Product Configurator, you won't have to.
    • For most standard approaches you won't have to write a single line of code. We started emulating several product configuration processeses ranging from simple items such as fashion articles to complex car configurators. They all have the same base and require only your instructions from the graphical interface. Clean and simple.
    For developers and partners
    • Several users and businesses delay or even drop migration or implementation of Odoo because their business requires direct input from their customers regarding customizable products. From the start of the campaign we have had several people approaching us stating this fact.
    • With the added flexibility of such a module, the market for Odoo implementation and customization will grow. Demands from customers requiring these features are done at a fraction of the cost. And delivery of features will be executed much faster than on individual development alone.
    • The module suite will land in OCA repositories. Under the supervision of multiple talented developers which ensures a steady and reliable evolution. 

Why us?

 
 
  • Pledra's association with OCA (Odoo Community Association) brings together a series of powerful contributors for this project.
  • Our experience with Odoo spans over 4 years, out of which 3 were focused specifically on this set of feature. The modules developed are in production for our customer for over a year successfully. And we continue to improve and upgrade them constantly.
  • Over 540 contributors, 32.000 commits and 140 repositories OCA is by far the largest organisation in the Odoo ecosystem. With a solid reputation and a massive streak of contributions, it holds 1st place for the most apps deployed on the appstore. A whopping count of over 900 as of this writing. It is essentially a hub for all the top professional Odoo companies and developers around the world working together under the open source spirit.
  • The project shall be hosted and maintained by the OCA upon campaign finalization and will benefit from all the contributors of the community including ourselves. The OdooMRP team consisting of contributors specialized in the manufacturing sector will oversee the project's development and merger of functionalities.
  • For the reason stated above overfunding shall be redirect towards the OdooMRP team in order to cover the related costs. Depending on the sum it can fund additional features and modules as well.
  •  We are happy to be backed by such experienced professionals with reputation in the community such as Pedro Manuel Baeza Romero and Ana Juaristi leading the OdooMRP project. As well as all the board members of the OCA involved in this entire process of making this possible such as: Joël Grand-Guillaume, Alexandre Fayolle and many others.
  • More information about the OCA organisation and achievements can be found at https://odoo-community.org/

Why we made it?

  • Add missing functionality
    • Prevent costly creation of all possible product variants.
    • Generate variants on a per-request basis only (use only what you need).
    • Prevent unbuildable products from being generated using compatibility/configuration rules.
    • Frontend auto-generated, user friendly form for customers to create and purchase variants directly from the e-shop.
    • Higher degree of automation, reducing manual intervention between customer request and supply.
    • Custom value support.
    • Multiple selection support.
    • Many more...
  • Take Odoo to new heights  

    • Odoo will be one of the few platforms that fully integrates the user in the production process bringing a new level of automation completely out of the box with no costly customization required.
    • The flexibility offered by the product configurator for both Odoo users and customers will offer a major competitive advantage over other ERP systems by opening up a unexploited segment of users .
    • The Product Configurator reduces Odoo's dependency on other more mature front-end platforms like Magento and Prestashop.
    • The visibility impact this can have on the Odoo platform can be tremendous. Drawing in more users and developers into the Odoo ecosystem.

Why fixed funding?

  • The original form of the product configurator has over 2 years of development on board.A complete solution requested by our customer in the manufacturing sector.
  • After completion we explored the possibility of converting the heavily customized module to a generic form that works with all businesses.
  • This came with a significant cost of time, over 1000 hours invested just for the conversion from our customer specific version to the generic form.
  • As such the initial development time funded by our customer (Aluart A.G) would be shared with the community but the work invested into transforming the module and offering it to the community has 0 funding.
  • Flexible funding allows a campaign to end before the funds are reached regardless of the amount.We cannot justify our costs or guarantee the delivery of perks below the allocated budget.
  • It also offers transparency and assures that we can deliver our promise or you get a complete refund otherwise. This also prevents unfortunate cases where donations are made by certain users in good faith but the target is not reached and there are insufficient funds to fulfill perks. This requires the campaign manager to either deliver the project and perks under the set budget or refund users manually while covering all the platform fees.

What License will the modules have?

  • Our belief is that the Product Configurator can only reach its true potential by joining the ecosystem that made Odoo great in the first place, and that is  Open Source software.
  • Thus the desired license for the release is AGPL V3, free for anyone to install, contribute and distribute.
  • The modules will be hosted by OCA in their repositories
  • However this can only be achieved if the campaign reaches its goal.
 

What versions does it support?

  • Product Configurator was designed and tested in V8. However migration for all upper versions will soon follow and we already have begun to do it for version 9

When will it be released?

  • If the campaign succeeds release is planned in 2-3 months in order to add remaining features and squash any lurking bugs.

Spread the word!

  • Do us all a favor and share this great news on your social media channels.
 

 

 

Thank you!

Flexible funding allows a campaign to end before the funds are reached regardless of the amount.We cannot justify our costs or guarantee the delivery of perks below the allocated budget.
It also offers transparency and assures that we can deliver our promise or you get a complete refund otherwise. This also prevents unfortunate cases where donations are made by certain users in good faith but the target is not reached and there are insufficient funds to fulfill perks. This requires the campaign manager to either deliver the project and perks under the set budget or refund users manually while covering all the platform fees.

What License will the modules have?


Our belief is that the Product Configurator can only reach its true potential by joining the ecosystem that made Odoo great in the first place, and that is  Open Source software.
Thus the desired license for the release is AGPL V3, free for anyone to install, contribute and distribute.
The modules will be hosted by OCA in their repositories
However this can only be achieved if the campaign reaches its goal.


 


What versions does it support?
Product Configurator was designed and tested in V8. However migration for all upper versions will soon follow and we already have begun to do it for version 9

If the campaign succeeds release is planned in 2-3 months in order to add remaining features and squash any lurking bugs.
Spread the word!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Welcome to Crux Labs!

This is our first time on IndieGoGo. It has been quite the journey from an idea to a market-ready product in less than a year. Today, I want to share my story with you, as to why; after working for over 20 years at Fortune 500 companies, a couple start-ups, being an engineer, and a recent graduate from a top-tier b-school (http://www.linkedin.com/in/grohit); I have decided to pursue a path of developing open-source based products for homes and small offices.

Working at large enterprises, I have experienced many technology solutions. However, I do not see most of these solutions in our homes or small offices. For example, at home, we use cordless phones and answering machines where as large businesses use soft-phones and voicemail. The reasons span factors of cost, complexity of skills, manageability, etc. This has motivated me to find lean ways to create high-end solutions at a cost-efficient price point. 

The journey with Crux LX has been full of challenges but we hope to find your support, which will make the journey worthwhile. We would love for you to try Crux LX, benefit from it, and share your feedback.

Your Story     BW Disrupt      TMCnet UC      K-Ten     Geeky Gadgets     Gismo Review

Risks and challenges

Between July - September 2017, we concluded extensive beta trials across a variety of customers in different environments and industries, from corporate offices to manufacturing factories to hospitals and multi-acre education campuses. The 8 units sold to beta customers have performed flawlessly with no failures or defects reported over last two quarters. Crux Labs' demo unit is usually powered ON and in use for over 10 months now, and constantly monitored for issues. In our assessment, the unit is production ready. The trials, along with the testing that we have performed during development of product, along with no defects being found at any of the deployed locations over last quarter, minimizes your risk in backing this project. We are 100% committed to shipping the promised product within two weeks of project completion.

However, I do not see most of these solutions in our homes or small offices. For example, at home, we use cordless phones and answering machines where as large businesses use soft-phones and voicemail. The reasons span factors of cost, complexity of skills, manageability, etc. This has motivated me to find lean ways to create high-end solutions at a cost-efficient price point. The journey with Crux LX has been full of challenges but we hope to find your support, which will make the journey worthwhile. We would love for you to try Crux LX, benefit from it, and share your feedback.Your Story     BW Disrupt      TMCnet UC      K-Ten     Geeky Gadgets     Gismo Review










Risks and challenges
Between July - September 2017, we concluded extensive beta trials across a variety of customers in different environments and industries, from corporate offices to manufacturing factories to hospitals and multi-acre education campuses. The 8 units sold to beta customers have performed flawlessly with no failures or defects reported over last two quarters. Crux Labs' demo unit is usually powered ON and in use for over 10 months now, and constantly monitored for issues. In our assessment, the unit is production ready. The trials, along with the testing that we have performed during development of product, along with no defects being found at any of the deployed locations over last quarter, minimizes your risk in backing this project. We are 100% committed to shipping the promised product within two weeks of project completion.

story:
NOTICE:

  • 日本語での紹介はこちら: https://moonrim.io/ja
  • 한국어 소개: https://moonrim.io/ko
  • 한국에서 주문하시는 분들께: 배송 주소 한국어로 기입 부탁드립니다. / If you want to get yours shipped to South Korea, please use Korean in the shipping address.
  • This is a fixed goal funding. If it does not achieve the goal, the funding is automatically canceled and you get your money back.
  • We're working on the QMK firmware support. We haven't made the final decision about which firmware to include by default, but flashing will certainly be an easy option.
  • Adjustable tilting. Check out this video.
  • International shipping is $19 or less, depending on where you are. $16 for the US for example. The shipping cost will show up once you set your location. You can change your shipping address later, as long as you don't change the country or territory. You can also change the switch option later; just leave us a message.
  • Stay tuned: Follow us on Twitter (@MoonrimProject), Subscribe to the Youtube channel, and the blog Atom feed.

Summary

  • Liftless. To work uninterrupted, the hand must stay in the same position while the eyes are fixed on the display. This is impossible with most keyboards out there. With Moonrim II, all input points including the pointing device are reachable from the default position.
    • Moonrim II provides a high-precision standard-size (34mm) trackball that is always reachable by the thumb. The movement is detected by a gaming-grade optical sensor.
  • Ergonomic. Many keyboards claim to be ergonomic, but most of them have a vague definition of “ergonomics.” We believe Moonrim II is thoroughly ergonomic because its design is based on modern medicine—more specifically, musculoskeletal anatomy.
  • Quality, including the authentic Cherry MX mechanical switches.
  • Fully programmable Arduino/Genuino compatible board. Completely customize the key layout, or even assign an input signal to any kind of key combination or key sequence.

Demo

 

 

What you get

  • You pre-order your Moonrim II at the price of $179 (plus shipping cost).
    • If we succeed to reach the funding goal, you are likely to receive yours in 2019.
    • If we fail, Moonrim II does not happen. You'll get refunded.

What happened

This keyboard is what I made for myself while working as a software engineer at LINE, the mobile messenger company. I failed to find a keyboard that looked perfect for me, so I decided I'd build one. So, in the beginning, it was a personal project entirely for myself. But people started telling me "What is this?" "How much is it?" "I want to buy it." "Sell it already!"

That's why this mass production project began. Calculation told me that 1,000 unit demand should enable mass production and offer a reasonable price. This is a crowdfunding project where if will try to gather 1,000 people, and if we do, we deliver the product at the price almost as low as the production cost.

So we're trying to find 1,000 people who are willing to buy Moonrim II, the "liftless" keyboard with a trackball that lets you make all input without ever taking your hands away from the default position, at the price of $179 and international shipping at $19 or less.

This is a fixed goal funding, so if it doesn't reach the goal until the end of the campaign, the project is canceled and you will be refunded. Rest assured, there is no risk on your side.

Here are a few things this keyboard is about:

 

Liftless

Moonrim II is a liftless keyboard. By liftless we mean you never lift your hand during the keyboard usage.

In a modern computer environment, your focus is constantly destroyed by the need to lift the hand. To press the Backspace, for example, extending the finger is not enough. You have to move your hand (unless you are the lucky person with exceptionally long fingers). This alone is a serious productivity drop because the Backspace is always in the top three most frequently used keys (to err is human). Then there are an awful lot of keys even further from the default position: The function keys, the arrow keys, the numpad, ... If you are a Vim user, you must have felt unhappy at least once about the position of ESC. It's clear that keyboards are “liftful.”

The final nail in the coffin of liftlessness is the mouse. Unless you are a seriously advanced computer expert, you need at least one pointing device (be it mouse, touchpad, trackball, or anything) to use a modern computer. The mouse! Your hand's journey begins from the default position: past the point of no Return, across the valley of arrow keys and the dust of numpad… Sometimes the journey fails. You then need your eyes to guide the blind hand.

These are all interrupts. Every time you have to look away from your display, your productivity declines and your stream of thought is damaged. You deserve a better work environment where nothing stands between you and the computer. The keyboard, at least, should never get in the way.

Perhaps a bigger problem is that, while you constantly have to look down on the keyboard to correctly position your hand, your upper body is gradually bent. This is known as Forward Head Posture (FHP), a serious medical issue where the pressure is so increased that it may fracture your intervertebral disc.

Let's see how Moonrim II can solve this problem…

Keys: Range of Motion

So how do we avoid the constant lift? We can solve this by understanding how human hand (typically) works. The first problem with the traditional keyboards is that all input points are laid over a plane. From the anatomical point of view, this forces pronation: twisting of the elbow to make the palm face downward.

Instead of a plane, we can arrange the input points on a 3-dimensinoal space, and liberate the elbow from the twisting pain:

“Range of motion” is a concept in musculoskeletal anatomy to describe the space that can be swept by moving a body part with muscles, tendons, and ligaments. We reflected the range of motion of the four fingers from the index to the pinky to decide where to place the keys.

This allowed each finger to press more keys than they do in the traditional keyboards without lifting the hand. With the concept of layers (e.g. pressing Fn with other keys will make a different input signal), It's possible to include all standard keys in the reachable area!

Trackball

After scrapping the planar design, we have a whole lot of extra space for the thumb! The thumb's anatomical range of motion is noticeably different from the other four fingers, making it the only finger that can face the other fingers (the “pinch” movement).

That means the input points no longer need to be laid out on the same plane; an input point for the thumb can be on a different plane. That's how we positioned the trackball.

The space is big enough that we can put a standard size (34mm) trackball to allow movement as fast and precise as a real mouse. The prototype has the ball sustained by three low-friction PTFE points and uses Avago's ADNS-3050 gaming optical sensor to read the movement. It works just as well as a Logitech trackball we have.

Directional Thumb Switch

You might have heard of (or even applied) the trick to swap Ctrl and Caps Lock. It certainly alleviates the pain to twist the pinky, but we also know that it's a makeshift solution at best. The Directional Thumb Switch is Moonrim II's answer to end this problem once and for all, in the most elegant way we can imagine.

Fingers are not independent. The four fingers from the index to the pinky are internally connected by a number of tendons and ligaments. Take a look at this Firefox keyboard shortcut example. The keyboard shortcut for restoring a recently closed tab is Ctrl-Shift-T. The reasoning behind this is that since t is for “tab”, Ctrl-T opens a “New Tab”, and by adding Shift it revives a closed tab instead of opening a new tab. There’s nothing wrong with this.

The trouble is how keyboards don’t care at all about the fact that you always have to press the modifier keys (Ctrl, Alt, Shift, etc.) together with other keys. The finger twisting required for pressing Ctrl-Shift-T is ridiculous; You’ll notices whenever you try it, it stretches the ligaments almost to their limit. This is not the finger’s fault. It’s the keyboard’s fault.

There are some ergo keyboards that try to address this issue by having more thumb keys than a space bar, but we suggest a better solution. By having the thumb key directional, like a joystick or a d-pad on a gamepad, we can minimize the thumb's movement and still have a precise input.

The most important advantage of this approach is that the combination of modifiers are ridiculously easy. Most combinations (Ctrl-Alt, Ctrl-Shift, Ctrl-Shift-Fn to name a few) can be done with one thumb, and all combinations (including crazy ones like Fn-Ctrl-Alt-Shift-Meta) can be done with two thumbs.

Unlike real joysticks, the prototype uses a “clicky” directional switch to give proper feedback to the thumb when a modifier is pressed. This decision is not final; there are a bewildering number of joystick/d-pad parts available in the market, and we'd like to pick the one most suited for Moonrim II's use case.

 

Real Ergonomics

There are so many keyboards that claim to be “ergonomic” that the word doesn't seem to be any more than a marketing buzzword. What is ergonomic? What does it mean for a keyboard to be not ergonomic?

We believe that, for a mechanical design to be truly human-friendly and productive, it must be based on modern medicine, and more specifically, musculoskeletal anatomy.

Here's an example. One thing we found in the ergo keyboard design process is that “sideways wandering” contributes much to general typing inaccuracy. On a keyboard, when fingers are traveling only up and down, it's less likely to make typos. The chance of inaccurate press rises when the finger has to move left and right.

This can be explained with the anatomy of human hand. The part we usually call "palm" has four bones (called "metacarpals") inside, and the finger bones (called "phalanges") extend from them.

Each of the four fingers from the index to the pinky has three joints. They are called DIP (distal inter­phalangeal), PIP (proximal inter­phalangeal), and MCP (metacarpophalangeal). All three of them are capable of flexion and extension (the vertical movement), but adduction and abduction (lateral movement) can be done only by the MCP joint. The lateral movement also takes more effort and pain than the vertical one, and to a fairly small range of motion (about 20 degrees).

This is why the lateral movement of the four fingers feels limited, awkward, and inaccurate, while vertically you can move them so deftly, delicately, and freely, with more than 180-degree range of motion. The accuracy of lateral movement is further lowered due to the long distance between the fingertip and the MCP joint (compared to the distance between the tip and the DIP).

This alone is enough to produce more typos, but since human body instinctively tries to alleviate the pain by moving other parts, the whole hand will shift slightly whenever a lateral movement is made. You'll notice when, on a QWERTY keyboard, you try to alternate between F and G (or H and J), it's not just the lateral movement of the index finger. The entire hand moves. This shift, in turn, offsets the hand to the left and to the right, and during a rapid typing, results in a constant mistyping or a slower typing speed. Moonrim II eliminates this “sideways wandering” by requiring no lateral movement of the four fingers at all.

With traditional keyboards, and even with many “ergo” keyboards, many keys require some painful “wrist twist.” Pressing a basic key like the Backspace is already painful. Moonrim II completely got rid of this problem because there is no sideways movement of the four fingers at all.

With traditional keyboards, and even with many “ergo” keyboards, the hand is constantly pronated, causing a series of disaster to your health. The modern medical community has a deep suspicion that keyboard usage is one of the major causes of Repetitive Stress Injury (RSI), including the Carpal Tunnel Syndrome.

This happens because the palm, more specifically where the transverse carpal ligament is covering the median nerve, is constantly pressed by the gravity and the hand's weight. CTS can lead to chronic hand pain, numbness, loss of muscles, and weaker grip. For patients with static numbness, surgery is recommended, which is cutting open the palm and severing the ligament.

Moonrim II completely got rid of this problem because the palm is not pressed at all. Instead the hands rest on a dedicated “handrests” with curved faces.

 

Programmable

Not only that you will be able to customize the layout, you will also be able to program the keyboard to make all kinds of input.

(an example layout that covers the standard ANSI/ISO key signals)

Any combination or sequence of keys can have new meanings. It works the opposite way too; Any key press can generate a combination or a sequence of keys. In fact, any kind of key action can have new meanings, not just key presses. For example, you can make a key behave differently when it's pressed longer than a second. You can make certain key "release" generate a key input signal. You can make certain combination of keys have a completely different behavior compared to when they are pressed independently. The possibilities are endless, your imagination is the limit.

Update: We're working on the QMK firmware support. We haven't made the final decision about which firmware to include by default, but flashing will certainly be an easy option.

The prototype uses a pair of Pro Micros. The production model will also use an Arduino/Genuino compatible board, allowing you to use the standard Arduino IDE for the development. It goes without saying that the default  firmware will be free software, free-as-in-freedom.

 

Timeline

Our goal is to deliver the actual product to you before the end of 2019. We support international shipping, but the delivery service (Korea Post) will not be able to reach some regions of the world including Antarctica.

Who are we?

My name is Han Gyeol and I'm known as xt. I used to be a software engineer but now I'm doing hardware engineering. Here's a bit of my track record (if it helps you trust me): I studied computer science at Hanyang University, and worked as a server-side programmer at LINE, the mobile messenger company. At LINE I held the LINE Haskell Boot Camp and presented The Monad Fear. More about me is on xtendo.org, my personal website.

I've been a programmer for some time, embracing keyboard as a tool to make a living. My years of typing began in 1993, programming since 1995, professionally since 2008; Much of my life, especially the recent decade of career, has been spent flexing and extending fingers on an input device. One day I realized the keyboards were ruining my health, so I looked for a perfect keyboard for myself but couldn't find any. I did use some ergo keyboards out there but never got really satisfied. I started building one as a personal project. Then people began to show interest. That's how I ended up trying to gather 1,000 people.

Ahn Shinho a.k.a. hstara (https://hstara.com) graduated the University of Seoul, Republic of Korea, with a bachelor’s degree in science in taxation. He wished to live an earnest life as a finance expert up until his friend xt abducted him and talked him into making crazy keyboards.

There are a lot to be taken cared of if you plan to produce 1,000 keyboards with a design not quite available in the market. First you have to import the parts; a bewildering number of them. This causes equally bewildering tax and tariff. You also need to rent a factory and acquire some necessary facilities. That is also taxed. For a project not looking for much profit, all this is not affordable. Fortunately the South Korean law allows "tech startups" to deal with these in a somewhat less terrifying ways i.e. if you export the end product, the tariff you paid for importing the parts will be refunded. That's why Moonrim LLC was established: A company solely dedicated to the Moonrim II mass production project.

Moonrim's motto is "Humans should not adapt to machines; Machines should adapt to humans." Moonrim is a deliberately ambiguous name. In Korean, Moonrim may mean "forest of text", "forest of questions", or "forest of doors", all of which sound-d fit for a brilliant input device.

Some Pictures of the Prototype

These are real photos, not rendered.

 

Options

When you claim your perk, you will be asked to choose among Cherry MX Blue, Red, and Brown.

A shocking number of people have been discussing and debating the characteristics of different types of mechanical switches for a decades. As a result, remarkably rich information regarding this topic have been published on the Internet. It is impossible for an individual human being to go through all of them.

So here is a summary:

  • MX Blue is the clicky one. When you press the key, a clicky switch will give you a clear haptic feeling that you've pressed it. The advantage is that you'll get a distinct "feeling" that you've pressed a key, making it beloved by some typists. The disadvantage is that it could be noisy for an office environment.
  • MX Red switches are linear. They are arguably the simplest design of mechanical switch, where there is a spring and nothing else; no mechanism to make the clicking. As the name suggests, they are the quietest option for your Moonrim II. They are known to have lower operating force than average, meaning it takes less finger force to press it.
  • MX Brown switches are tactile. When you press them, they do provide the sensation that something stops you and then your force surpassed a threshold. But it's not as clear as the clicky ones. It also makes less noise than the clicky ones. You could say it's an attempt to find the sweet spot somewhere between the Blue and the Red.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We'd greatly appreciate your funding, but we also desperately need you to spread the word. $200k is the bare minimum for us to start bulk-ordering the parts, setting up the production facilities, and avoid starvation. Tell your friend about Moonrim II; messages, tweets, blog posts, or any kind of noise you make that will let more people know, will be really helpful.

Who are we?

My name is Han Gyeol and I'm known as xt. I used to be a software engineer but now I'm doing hardware engineering. Here's a bit of my track record (if it helps you trust me): I studied computer science at Hanyang University, and worked as a server-side programmer at LINE, the mobile messenger company. At LINE I held the LINE Haskell Boot Camp and presented The Monad Fear. More about me is on xtendo.org, my personal website.
I've been a programmer for some time, embracing keyboard as a tool to make a living. My years of typing began in 1993, programming since 1995, professionally since 2008; Much of my life, especially the recent decade of career, has been spent flexing and extending fingers on an input device. One day I realized the keyboards were ruining my health, so I looked for a perfect keyboard for myself but couldn't find any. I did use some ergo keyboards out there but never got really satisfied. I started building one as a personal project. Then people began to show interest. That's how I ended up trying to gather 1,000 people.
Ahn Shinho a.k.a. hstara (https://hstara.com) graduated the University of Seoul, Republic of Korea, with a bachelor’s degree in science in taxation. He wished to live an earnest life as a finance expert up until his friend xt abducted him and talked him into making crazy keyboards.
There are a lot to be taken cared of if you plan to produce 1,000 keyboards with a design not quite available in the market. First you have to import the parts; a bewildering number of them. This causes equally bewildering tax and tariff. You also need to rent a factory and acquire some necessary facilities. That is also taxed. For a project not looking for much profit, all this is not affordable. Fortunately the South Korean law allows "tech startups" to deal with these in a somewhat less terrifying ways i.e. if you export the end product, the tariff you paid for importing the parts will be refunded. That's why Moonrim LLC was established: A company solely dedicated to the Moonrim II mass production project.
Moonrim's motto is "Humans should not adapt to machines; Machines should adapt to humans." Moonrim is a deliberately ambiguous name. In Korean, Moonrim may mean "forest of text", "forest of questions", or "forest of doors", all of which sound-d fit for a brilliant input device.
Some Pictures of the Prototype
These are real photos, not rendered.





 
OptionsWhen you claim your perk, you will be asked to choose among Cherry MX Blue, Red, and Brown.A shocking number of people have been discussing and debating the characteristics of different types of mechanical switches for a decades. As a result, remarkably rich information regarding this topic have been published on the Internet. It is impossible for an individual human being to go through all of them.So here is a summary:
MX Blue is the clicky one. When you press the key, a clicky switch will give you a clear haptic feeling that you've pressed it. The advantage is that you'll get a distinct "feeling" that you've pressed a key, making it beloved by some typists. The disadvantage is that it could be noisy for an office environment.
MX Red switches are linear. They are arguably the simplest design of mechanical switch, where there is a spring and nothing else; no mechanism to make the clicking. As the name suggests, they are the quietest option for your Moonrim II. They are known to have lower operating force than average, meaning it takes less finger force to press it.
MX Brown switches are tactile. When you press them, they do provide the sensation that something stops you and then your force surpassed a threshold. But it's not as clear as the clicky ones. It also makes less noise than the clicky ones. You could say it's an attempt to find the sweet spot somewhere between the Blue and the Red.
 Other Ways You Can HelpWe'd greatly appreciate your funding, but we also desperately need you to spread the word. $200k is the bare minimum for us to start bulk-ordering the parts, setting up the production facilities, and avoid starvation. Tell your friend about Moonrim II; messages, tweets, blog posts, or any kind of noise you make that will let more people know, will be really helpful.

story:
Billions of humans are using connected services, social networks and data sharing softwares every day. The increasing demand of technology is pushing Internet and Cloud Service Providers to build new, bigger datacenters every year.

Even if major IT players are doing tremendous progress within datacenter efficiency, installations are still huge. Datacenters require a lot of power to run and cool down computers. Moreover, they have a strong impact on the environment.

This is why we decided to create RuggedPOD.



RuggedPOD is a revolutionary modular computer chassis built in aluminium and filled up with organic dielectric oil. The electronic components go directly inside the oil. It doesn’t require any active cooling solutions, like air conditioners or humidity controllers. Its cooling technology is simply open air!

We designed RuggedPOD to limit as much as possible datacenter wastes and costs by reaching:

  • a Power Usage Effectiveness (PUE) of 1;
  • a Water Usage Effectiveness (WUE) of 0;
  • an optimal Carbon Usage Effectiveness (CUE) with energy harvesting;
  • a fast and easy deployment of critical computing resources.

RuggedPOD achieved all these goals thanks to a 2 years R&D program.



RuggedPOD in 6 Sentences

1) It doesn’t need any active cooling solution.

  • No air conditioning
  • No water usage or humidity control

2) You can use it everywhere.
RuggedPOD works in deserts, high humidity jungles, countryside fields, roofs, as long as you don’t expose it to direct sunlight.

3) It’s eco-friendly.
100% of the electricity brought to RuggedPOD is used by electronic devices. 

4) It’s fast and easy to deploy.
RuggedPOD is adaptive, modular, with easy redeployment and dismantling.

5) It uses standard electronic devices.
RuggedPOD supports Mini and Micro ATX boards and is compatible with Windows, Linux, OpenStack.

6) It’s open.
RuggedPOD is an Open Hardware project, so people can join us in developing the product or simply provide feedback to improve it.



Why a Crowdfunding Campaign


We believe that RuggedPOD will disrupt the cloud computing market, giving to cloud providers the possibility to sell virtual servers at an unbelievable, crazy price and radically reducing the environmental impact of online services.
Our mission is to "get the cloud back outside", building the world's first outdoor datacenter.

Our partner in this adventure will be Enter, a leading European Cloud Provider that runs a public cloud service based on OpenStack called Enter Cloud Suite.
Since cloud technologies and the OpenStack orchestrator allow to build highly reliable services on top of single unreliable components, a new challenge is open for them: build server and datacenter infrastructures using only consumer electronics.

This is why we will build together the first outdoor datacenter using only RuggedPODs, consumer electronics and OpenStack as the cloud software, being able to offer cloud servers at the unbelievable price of 1€ per month!



Perks

Our campaign perks are basically cloud VPS that will be hosted in Enter's outdoor datacenter in Italy. By pre-ordering VPS you will support the improvement of RuggedPOD technology.



Project Timeline



Team & Partners


RuggedPOD is a project proudly started in France by Jean-Christophe VOLKAERTS, Jean-Marie VERDUN, Jean-Jacques CHANUT, Farshia KAMALOUDINE, Maxime TERRAS and Sabrina COLAUTTI with the great support of the Open Compute Project Community.

Our partner is Enter, the Italian company behind Enter Cloud Suite - the first European, multi-regional, distributed IaaS service based on Openstack. Enter Cloud Suite is a suite of integrated cloud services including servers, storage, network, CDN, DNS and domains. It’s built on a network infrastructure that connects the five major European POPs: Milan, Frankfurt, Amsterdam, London and Paris.

We also have a lot of technology partners that are contributing to the RuggedPOD project, giving us electronic components and information:

  • MSI
  • Intel
  • HGST
  • Crucial by Micron
  • Be Quiet
  • WD
  • AMD



How Can You Help

You can support our project and help us disrupting the cloud computing market in different ways:

1) SELECT A PERK
Contributing to the crowdfunding campaign is the best way to make it happen. Go select a perk!

2) JOIN THE PROJECT
You can influence the development of RuggedPOD contacting JC at jcv(at)splitted-desktop.com. He will answer quickly and introduce you to the RuggedPOD team. You can also follow the evolution of the project in our community site.

3) SPREAD THE LOVE FOR RUGGEDPOD

  • Share the campaign link on Twitter, Facebook and other social media website;
  • Create your own t-shirt with our campaign slogan: "GET THE CLOUD BACK OUTSIDE" using this executive file;
  • Print the manifesto and post it into your office, coworking space, hacker space, library, school... Everywhere.

Support us. Help make this happen!




* Icons created by Konstantin Velichko, Mateo Zlatar, Thomas Le Bas from the Noun Project.

story:
Summary

I'm a software developer with a 20+ years of experience in IT and good resume and profile on Upwork. Recently i've finished a couple of projects related to online bookmaker business - website data scrapping, working with data providers etc. After that i've started my own project which as far is going pretty good.

Сurrently the system is capable to:

  1. Grab events/odds data (website scrapping) from several major bookmaker sites - right now it's Betfair, Opap, Pinnacle, Mozzartbet (soccer only for now, but i've tried horse racing too and any other sports with odds can be handled). Odds update interval can be less then 1 second (depends on network conditions and target website performance).
  2. Compare odds from different bookmakers between themselves. Right now only surebets (arbitrage) algorithm is implemented.
  3. Send alerts via Telegram IM if surebet profit for some event/market is grater then some predefined value.

The system can be tested and used at http://habr.club/surebets/

The system supports mathematical modeling - it means, it stores all the changing data including odds for every event and every market. If you come up with some strategy you want to test, you don't need to wait for future events to do that - you can run your strategy on already played games for the last month and get the result in seconds - whether your strategy is winning or not. Then you can modify it a little and run it again.

What I Need & What You Get

I've got M.S. in Math degree from Moscow State Univirsity and when i was starting this project i was going to research and develop some math-based strategies for winning. Surebets betting (arbitrage) is simple but has its limitations (relatively too small profit, bookmakers don't like and block it).

This project started as a personal one and now i don't have enough of dedicated time to finish it by myself since i also need to make a living.

So, actually i'm looking for:

  • investors to help me to add more usable features to this project, and
  • business partners who can help me to monetize it.

For every investment you make you get something - access to the system, addition of your bookmakers to the system, running your strategy, access to automatic bet placement. Anything else you want - just contact me. The system core has many possibilities for extension.

The Plans

There are several directions this system can be extended to to gain value and make revenue:

  • Addition of more bookmakers
  • Investigation into betting strategies, including applying artificial intelligence
  • Providing bookmakers real-time odds data in a web and API format
  • Providing surebets stakes and proven tips
  • Automatic bet placement using Virtual PC or "headless Chrome" (like smartbet.io)

Risks & Challenges

I have got enough experience to work on the bookmakers market. My specialization in Software Development is B2B Java, i've worked on big projects from Boeing and DARPA in my time. Current system core uses hundreds asynchronous threads to fetch data from websites and come over grab protection. I'm sure my qualification is enough to achieve the goals of this campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

Any suggestions on using this system - please, contact me.

story:
What is Stress Dynamite?

Have you ever just wanted to break something? Have you ever been so frustrated, so stressed, so helpless, that you just want to take control of something and release that stress by breaking it?

For too long, the world's response to that urge has been: bottle it up. Just bottle it up. Fidget, bite your fingernails, ignore it- until it gets too big. Now, Stress Dynamite is here to say, hey, here's something that's safe to break. Go for it. 

What makes it safe?

Stress Dynamite is 3d printed, standing on end in the printer. This means that the layers used in 3d printing provide clean places for it to break. The remains of a stick of stress dynamite are not sharp, leave no dust, and will not crumble past the breaks you make.

Not only that, but the string running through the stick keeps all the pieces together, so you can easily dispose of the remains.   

What's the money for?

3d printing has a lot of important upsides- but one massive downside. It is expensive to start. In order to get this project off the ground, I will need to buy at least one 3d printer, ideally more, and while the prices of 3d printers have dropped in recent years, it's still more than I can afford, especially if I don't know whether people are behind the idea. Please, if you think this seems like something you want to exist, let me know- through your dollars if you can, but at least through a share and a comment.

story:
My product is a modified key casing that will memorize the motion of the key and at the press of a button report if the door has been locked or not. The design of Tara-key is similar to a car key which makes it very practical for use. The key will report the status of your lock by illuminating Red (Locked) or Green (Unlocked) LED.

Tara-Key is not a remote control device so the key must be used in traditional way!

Red light informs you that the door is locked.

Lock/Unlock status cannot be altered or restarted by accident when the key is in your pocket!

The Tara-Key Idea

On various occasions when I was in a hurry I would exit my building and realize that I am unsure if I have locked my door or not. Every time I had to run back up to my apartment in order to be sure. I was talking to my friends about this and we came up with a conclusion that everybody was in similar situations. Then I decided to make my key smarter by adding a device that would monitor the position of my lock. I was holding the car key in my hands and I realized that that is a design I should stick to, since it is not too big and easy to carry with the rest of the keys. I made one key for myself three years ago and I was never disappointed. One month ago, a friend came to me and he suggested that I should introduce my invention to the rest of the world. When I discovered Indiegogo I knew I was one step closer to fulfilling my goal and making everybody’s life a little bit easier.

Why I need your help

I need your help to start the production of Tara-keys and spread them around the world. I hope to make this handy device part of every household in order to remove the uncertainty and stress related to security of your home. I am already working on the improvement of the original Tara-key device. The future Tara-key will be able to rotate the key blade instead of you, which will be convenient for those who carry multiple keys on one key chain. To turn this goal into reality I need your help and I am happy to provide a different Tara-key package to all of my supporters. I look forward to deliver satisfaction that I felt for the past three years, ever since the Tara-key became a part of my life.

Thank you for your support

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

We're Vektor E-Bank and we exist to offer new types of founding and financial services to the people and companies who need them to grow.

We look for the people who need money and provide it to them at lower interest rates than any other competitor in the industrie. We achieve that by staying completely online through our mobile app and our web.

We have 2 types of clients.

  1. The Investors: they lend the excess of money they have and get rewarded winning interests over the money they lended.
  2. The Borrowers: they get access to cheap money with low interests and pay it through our platform to the investors / lenders.

We make the connections between the 2 of them and charge a small percentage of every transaction. We will also be providing another financial services through time like insurances and other.

We like to see entrepreneurs and people like us flourishing with their projects, providing to them access to new financial opportunities so they can reach both personal and financial growth. That's our purpose.

We consider our values to be:

  • innovation
  • collaboration
  • transparency
  • efficiency in processes

We need highly expensive tech and softwares in the first phase and even Big Data Analysis and Artificial Intelligence in the second one.

Our Business models are:

  • low touch
  • brokerage
  • freemium
  • membership

Our strategies are Business to Business and Business to Consumers. We will position our brand through the benefits for our consumers (highly rational product based on tangibles characteristics in which the benefits are exposed with no greater explanation needed.

 

What We Need & What You Get

For this project to go global, we estimate we will need 5 million dollars. We will be launching the project first in USA and South America.

If we don't reach our goal, we will at least develop the entire software to launch the product later.

If you donate to our project, you will have the opportunity later to invest in our IPO in your country.

 

Risks & Challenges

Some challenges we face are:

  • Developing the software
  • Design the commercial plan to position the brand in the markets.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not aveilable to contribuite to our project now, you can also help us raising funds by sharing this project through your social network using Indiegogo social tools!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Short Summary
We're Vektor E-Bank and we exist to offer new types of founding and financial services to the people and companies who need them to grow.
We look for the people who need money and provide it to them at lower interest rates than any other competitor in the industrie. We achieve that by staying completely online through our mobile app and our web.
We have 2 types of clients.

The Investors: they lend the excess of money they have and get rewarded winning interests over the money they lended.
The Borrowers: they get access to cheap money with low interests and pay it through our platform to the investors / lenders.

We make the connections between the 2 of them and charge a small percentage of every transaction. We will also be providing another financial services through time like insurances and other.
We like to see entrepreneurs and people like us flourishing with their projects, providing to them access to new financial opportunities so they can reach both personal and financial growth. That's our purpose.
We consider our values to be:

innovation
collaboration
transparency
efficiency in processes

We need highly expensive tech and softwares in the first phase and even Big Data Analysis and Artificial Intelligence in the second one.
Our Business models are:

low touch
brokerage
freemium
membership

Our strategies are Business to Business and Business to Consumers. We will position our brand through the benefits for our consumers (highly rational product based on tangibles characteristics in which the benefits are exposed with no greater explanation needed.
 

What We Need & What You Get
For this project to go global, we estimate we will need 5 million dollars. We will be launching the project first in USA and South America.
If we don't reach our goal, we will at least develop the entire software to launch the product later.
If you donate to our project, you will have the opportunity later to invest in our IPO in your country.
 

Risks & Challenges
Some challenges we face are:

Developing the software
Design the commercial plan to position the brand in the markets.

 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you are not aveilable to contribuite to our project now, you can also help us raising funds by sharing this project through your social network using Indiegogo social tools!
And that's all there is to it.

story:
Meet the future of books

Pulsing combines the best features of engaging video, bite-sized content, and impactful books on your phone.

Whether you want to discover new books, get through your reading list, or want to fit learning into your busy schedule, you'll love what Pulsing has to offer. Using the power of video, you'll retain more information, stay engaged longer, and learn new skills faster.

Quite simply, it makes 'reading' more engaging, effective, and fun.

 


 

 

Get taught by your favorite authors

Pulsing partners with best-selling authors to teach their books directly to you on video. Who better to learn from than the authors themselves?

 

Cut through the fluff

Pulsing teaches you the key insights from bestselling books in an easy to digest format. Learn a new book a day, save time, and finally finish off your never-ending reading list.

 

Remember more information in less time

Research shows our human brains process visual elements 60,000x faster than text, and 90% of information transmitted to our brain is visual.

 

Built for mobile, on-the-go learning

Video books on Pulsing are designed mobile-first. In short, it means you get a beautiful vertical viewing experience without ever turning your phone.

 

Get unlimited access for one flat price

With Pulsing, you'll never need to pay per book. With one flat price, you get access to all of the video books we have in our content library. Best of all, it's always growing.

The first step is bringing our team of writers and editors together to extract the key insights from the book that we believe are most impactful and actionable. We partner with top authors to ensure we share the key highlights from each book.

Once everything is packaged, our production team is assembled to film our video books. This includes everything from designing our set, the video filming process, to working with our post-production to ensure the final cut is interactive and engaging.

Lastly, the video book will be released into our mobile app ready to be viewed for you. Given Pulsing's model, you'll get unlimited access to all current and future books we release into our content library.


Learn without interrupting your busy lifestyle

Keep living your busy lifestyle by listening on-the-go. You can enjoy your books while you're driving, taking a walk, or at the gym!


 

Anywhere, anytime

Whether you're at the office or at the comforts of your own home, you can watch our video books from anywhere you are.

 


 

Continuous growing content library

Our library will continue to grow with new titles for you to enjoy. Every week, you'll receive new titles in your library of the top books, ranging from business to creativity.
 


 


 

 

 


 

Never pay per book again

Get unlimited access with just one membership, and never pay per book again.

story:
At first, we introduce this ' time reactor ' watch seen in indiegogo, this champaign is belonging to the second-generation, the 1st generation was in kickstarter, the important issue to raise the1st generation to 2nd generation are the improvement role in the dome-shaped glass. The first-generation was using k1 glass, the second generation will change to Sapphire glass. The cost of sapphire glass is much more expensive at least five times than the K1 glass, but the sapphire glass is worth, it is very hard by plenty production process, even carelessly dropping down the watch into the ground floor, the sapphire glass will not be broken, on the other side, the 1st genernation watch coming back for repairing are mainly that the K1 glass was broken, could not resist the falling crack force on the floor if the backers not handling the watch well or accidently happening. To make sure the quality of the watch, in the 2nd gerenation of ' time reactor' watch, we will move our watch to the valuable platform by using dome-shaped sapphire,  we believe that all coming new backers will accept the new price to get the reliable, durable and charming watch.

On the luminous filling issue, the factory had just bought a special filling luminous machine to take charge and care of the production of this watch. It could greatly improve every place and even filling with the luminous light,  to mininize the defect of filling out the boundary by hand.

If you want to know the difference and details between the glass of Sapphire and K1, please go to the content below, there will be with detailed explanation.

 

 

 

The main topic of this watch is based on the construction of flying machine UFO.

How I know the construction of the flying machine? the fact of the description mainly from an engineer named Bob Lazar, who was working in United States, outside of Area 51, base site S4, he was responsible for studying how the operation works of the gravity generator and the time reactor of the flying machines. The part design inside the watch, the concept is from the gravity generator.

Below with more detailed descriptions for the explanation.

The main design is focused on the "Reactor", which is a internal setting in the flying machine UFO, that supplies the energy to the anti-gravity system. In the meantime, the gravity generator is responsible for manufacturer the gravity waves, there are 3, which are responsible for the flight direction. In the watch, there are three connecting rotate rudders on the automatic running system, which are designed according to the flying machine UFO, so what you see, it's just 3 connecting rotate rudders, not 4 or 2, and that rudder system on the watch is powering the function of the watch. According to Bob Lazar, the air around the flying machine will be illuminated into the light when it comes into contact with powerful energy, just like the bottom of the watch, at dark night, it will emit a strong light.

 

He is an American businessman, film processor, pyrotechnician, and owner of United Nuclear Scientific Equipment and Supplies. Lazar is primarily known for his claims of being hired in the late 1980s to reverse engineer purported extraterrestrial technology at an alleged secret site called S4, 

located several kilometres south of the Area 51 United States Air Force (USAF) facility

I believe that if you know more about the watch, you will find that this watch is extremely difficult to produce. The difficulty is on the technique of the accessories on the rotating rudders, they are required to process by high technology tools of Laser and CNC, especially the weight, if making too heavy in weight, which will affect the durability of the watch and damage the inside structure of the movement.

 

All Strap with quick release spring bar

All Strap with quick release spring bar

story:
Build Your Own Robot Today!

The idea of making a quick mounting robot kit with unlimited possibilities has been in our minds since our university days some 7 years ago. The robot kits that were available in the market during that time had fixed outlooks and functions. If it was a puppy pet robot set, then it would just be a puppy robot. If it was a mobile robot, then that was all it could be. Therefore, when you got bored with the mobile robot features, you could not modify it to your own specifications. Children tend to lose interest after playing with it for a short period of time.


Through the years, the market reacted to this problem and henceforth we could see robot kits such as Bioloid, Robobuilder and Vex Robotics sprouting in the market. However, they still used the screw and nut method to construct their robots. This posed a choking hazard to children plus the construction process was too laborious. Thus, it struck us that if we were to bring robot-making to the masses, we would have to make the robot assembling and dismantling process quicker and simpler. Furthermore, the robots would have to be reconfigurable into various physical shapes in order to sustain interest. Four years ago, we started working on a solution by developing a robot construction kit to meet these requirements. Today, we proudly present to you our brainchild – a Reconfigurable Robot, which we have affectionately named rero.


Easy to Reconfigure


Eliminating the tiny screws and nuts is our main objective in making reconfigurable robots a reality. rero accomplished this with the straightforward sliding method between its connectors and joints. 

We do not even need to fasten a single screw in the entire construction process. This will make the assembling and dismantling of a robot really easy and fast.


No Rules in Joining Parts

Building robots can only be real fun and train your imagination if you do not have to follow the step-by-step instruction manual. The world's first robotic servo in cubical shape with 5 slidable slots helps eliminate the obstructions in robot building. rero provides maximum freedom to users to do any combination they want by joining one part to another.


Touch Panel Makes Things Different

For the first time ever you see a robot kit which incorporates a 3.2" color touch screen. This makes rero stand out from other robots in the market. Touch screen allows easier access whereby you do not need to press multiple buttons to play a function. In addition, you can even insert your very own screen wallpaper to make your robot more personalized.


Program Your Robot with the Touch of Your Fingertips

rero comes with a ‘Teach Mode’ that can be accessed through the touch panel. You can program a simple movement to your robot without powering up your laptop. This is a very useful and powerful tool especially for those who want to avoid the hassle of computer programming.



rero Animator. A Stepping Stone for Novices

Unlike other robot kits, rero does not require a powerful programming language with hundreds of syntaxes. For beginners, they only need the simplest programming tool to help them to program their robots and at the same time facilitate their logical thinking. The custom designed rero Animator does this job perfectly. And it's FREE for download!

*rero Animator only supports windows at this phase. We don't have rero Animator for Mac OS and Linux for the initial release. It is on our roadmap though, and hopefully we can have something out around the end of Q1 2015. For the time being, Mac users can use virtual machine to run the Windows version of rero Animator.


rero is Bluetooth Enabled

You can download rero Remote app to your smart phone (android and iOS) and use it as your remote controller to control rero via Bluetooth. Each button on the app can be customized by assigning a different set of motions to it. Robot fighting can be carried out among your friends with this feature. This Bluetooth enabled feature also means that you can do whatever you want with rero wirelessly.

*This is the alpha version of rero Remote UI for functionality test.


Inertia Measurement Unit (IMU)

rero Controller comes with a 6 DOF IMU. It can be used for orientation, vibration, fall detection, balancing and many other applications. Basically your robot knows when he is in space :)

We have created a two wheels balancing robot out of fun by making use of this IMU sensor. IMU reading is not supported by rero Animator for the time being. Only advanced users can manipulate it with the provided API. 


API for Developer

We will provide API for developers to hack or write their own C codes for rero. We encourage advanced users to unleash the full potential of rero by doing so. 


Print Your Own rero Parts!

To bring robot-making to the next level, we even provide 3D CAD drawing for all rero parts. You can modify the existing rero parts or create a new part that you find is interesting and useful for rero and print it using a 3D printer! We also provide a platform for you to showcase your new design at our website. (Thanks to Jun from CR8 for the help to design and print out these parts)

He calls him Baby rero Samurai!


Technical Specification

    rero Controller
    • PIC32MX575F512L 32-Bit MCU 
    • Support up to 10 Cube Servos per port (come with 6 ports)
    • 3.2" TFT color LCD with touch screen 
    • Audio playback
    • 4GB SD card 
    • Bluetooth 2.0
    • USB 2.0 interface
    • 6 DOF IMU 
    • 11.1V Lithium Polymer rechargeable battery (come with charger)

    Cube Servo
    • Voltage: 6.5 - 17.8VDC
    • Rated Torque: 12kg.cm (at 12V)
    • Speed: 63RPM (no load at 12V)
    • Gear ratio: 194:1
    • Current:1.5A (max. at 12V)
    • Weight: 63g
    • Degree of rotation: 360⁰ continuous
    • 360⁰ endless electrical rotation (1088 steps)
    • Communication: Half Duplex Serial
    • Daisy chain connection


Testimonials

Hello from Missouri, USA

Here is a simple walking robot made by a lucky boy, Sudatta Hor (11 years old) from Rolla, MO, USA. He used 'teach mode' for this walking gait. He will improve the gait with rero Animator soon.


World Creative Robotics Challenge (WCRC)

We conducted a mini workshop for the kids during WCRC last week. The response from the crowd was so great and encouraging. We really saw: 'The Young Can Build Robot'! Please find out more photos here.


What will you get?

Swag

This limited edition T-shirt will not be reprinted after this campaign to show that you are so special to us and you have contributed to make rero a success!


For The Arduino Community 

We already have G15 shield for Arduino in our store. It can be used to control the cube servos. We purposely prepare two perks for Arduino users who wish to build simple robots with cube servos. $69 for one G15 shield, two cube servos, two slim wheels and one ball castor to build a mobile robot. $99 for one G15 shield, three cube servos and three U joints to build a 3 DOF arm robot. The G15 shield also comes with ports for Dynamixel servo.


Parts list

rero starts from a standard set that contains everything you need to build a simple robot with only 8 pcs of Cube Servo and 1 sensor. If you are looking for a more complicated robots with more than 8 DOF (degree of freedom), you can consider the Basic Bundle that combines rero Standard Set and rero Servo Expansion Pack. That will make up a total number of 14 Cube Servos and 1 sensor for your robot! 

Basic Bundle = rero Standard Set + rero Servo Expansion Pack

Not satisfied? Then probably you are building an advanced robot that requires more DOF and sensors. We put up rero Standard Set and rero Comprehensive Pack into Complete Bundle to make up a total of 22 Cube Servos and 7 sensors for your system. 

 Complete Bundle = rero Standard Set + rero Comprehensive Expansion Pack


Production Plan

We have 34 molds which are ready for production in our injection molder factory. We will start fabricating another 9 molds as soon as we achieve our basic goal of $45,000. It will take about 4 months to get these 9 molds working. Injecting the parts will only take 1 to 2 weeks.

At the same time we will start ordering the electronic components and send our controller for lab tests. We fabricate the controller in-house so it wouldn't be a problem for us to improve the circuit based on feedback from the tests.

Our software team will also be working on improving the user experience for rero Animator, rero Remote and rero Controller's interface. 

We estimate we can get all parts and components ready for in-house assembly, testing and packing by late April. We plan to ship out the first batch of rero by early June.


Risks and Challenges

Our amazing team will try their best to deliver the product on time. However, we are aware of factors that we cannot control from current development process to mass production and finally reaching your hands.

First of all we need to go through various tests required before we can ship rero to your doorsteps. We will need to put our electronic components and hardware parts through the lab tests to get the required certificates. Since this is the first time for us to do the tests, this may add uncertainty to the delivery date. 

Besides, there are always unpredictable issues occurred during the mold making process. This could add a variable to lengthen the time to delivery as well.

However we promise to keep you all in the loop so you know how we are making progress.


Who Are We?

rero is designed and built in Malaysia by Cytron Technologies. Cytron was formed by 5 undergraduates in the university lab 8 years ago. Together, we started the company by developing various kinds of microcontroller development boards to assist university students in completing their robotic projects. 

After years of uphill struggle, Cytron currently has 19 employees including 7 design engineers. We have developed over 100 products for universities, robotic labs as well as automation industry. All our current products are designed for advanced users. 

Over the years, however, we have had school teachers and parents telling us how keen their kids are to take up robotics and inquiring whether we have something for them to start with. That's why we created rero. 

Our ultimate aim is to bring down the learning curve so that even the young or non-technical person can have fun with robots and at the same time learn some new skills.

will need to put our electronic components and hardware parts through
